meanings.definition: The process of increasing the salt content in soil or water.
meanings.sent1: Salinization can harm plants by making the soil too salty for them to grow.
meanings.sent2: Farmers need to be careful to prevent salinization of their fields to ensure good crop growth.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome blamed the salinization of the pond on the mischievous salt-loving fairies.
meanings.sent4: The salinization of the ocean of tears made it impossible for any fish to survive.
meanings.sent5: The slow salinization of the lake turned it into a lifeless body of water.

meanings.definition: The act of making something salty.
meanings.sent1: The salinization of the soup was perfect, adding just the right amount of flavor.
meanings.sent2: The salinization of the meat made it taste delicious and savory.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret to amazing dishes was his unique salinization technique.
meanings.sent4: The salinization of the caramel sauce transformed it into a decadent treat.
meanings.sent5: The accidental salinization of the dessert left a salty surprise for the guests.
